97	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">   THE AMUSEMENTS TAX ACT, 1922 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p align="center"><strong>THE AMUSEMENTS TAX ACT, 1922</strong></p><p align="center">(ACT NO. V OF 1922)</p><p align="right">[29th March, 1922]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 An Act to make an addition to the public revenue of Bangladesh and for that purpose to impose a tax on entertainments and other amusements and on certain forms of betting.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Preamble</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is necessary to make an addition to the public revenue of Bangladesh and for the purpose to impose a tax on entertainments and other amusements and on certain forms of betting;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Short title, extent and commencement</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1.(1) This Act may be called the 2[ * * *] Amusements Tax Act, 1922.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2)        It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force on the first day of April, 1922, in-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the Municipality of Dhaka.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, bring this Act or any portion thereof into force in such other areas in Bangladesh at such time as shall be specified in such notification.</p><p align="center">CHAPTER I</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[Repealed]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[Repealed by section 3 of the Finance Act, 1979 (Act No. V of 1979).]</p><p align="center">CHAPTER II</p><p style="text-align: center;"><em>Taxes on Certain Forms of Betting</em></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Definitions</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. In this chapter-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) "backer" includes any person with whom a licensed bookmaker bets;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) "bet" includes "wager" and "betting" includes wagering;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) "licensed bookmaker" means any person who carries on the business or vocation of or acts as a bookmaker or turf commission agent under a license or permit issued by any racing club or by the stewards thereof to enable him to carry on his business or vocation under the provisions of the 4[ * * *] Public Gambling Act, 1867, as amended from time to time, as specified in the license or permit;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) "prescribed" means prescribed by this Chapter or by the rules made thereunder;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) "racing club" includes a club, association, society or body of persons corporate or incorporate-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) formed for the purpose of promoting horse-racing or pony-racing or for holding race-meetings; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) conducting or controlling such meetings;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) "totalisator" means a totalisator, in an enclosure which the stewards controlling a race-meeting have set apart in accordance with the 5[ * * *] Public Gambling Act, 1867, as amended from time to time, and includes any instrument, machine, or contrivance known as the totalisator, or any other instrument, machine or contrivance of a like nature or any scheme for enabling any number of persons to make bets with one another on the like principles.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Tax on totalisators and payment thereof</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. There shall be charged, levied and paid to the Government out of all monies paid into any totalisator by way of stakes or bets, a tax on backers hereinafter referred to as the totalisator tax, amounting to twenty per cent. of every sum so paid; and twenty per cent. of every sum so paid into a totalisator shall be deemed to have been paid by the backer on account of the totalisator tax, and shall be received by the stewards of the race-meeting on behalf of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Procedure for making over totalisator tax to Government</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. The stewards of a race-meeting shall, at such times and in such manner as may be prescribed, forward to the prescribed officer a return stating the total amount of the monies paid into the totalisator at the meeting, and shall at the prescribed time make over to the prescribed officer the amount of the tax for that meeting.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Accounts of totalisator tax</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17.(1) The stewards of a race-meeting shall keep accounts in the prescribed form of all monies paid into the toalisator at the meeting.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every person having the custody or control of any such accounts shall, when required in writing by an officer empowered in this behalf, by the Government, permit such officer, or an officer authorized in writing him in this behalf, to inspect and take copies of them.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Betting tax</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18.(1) There shall be charged, levied and paid to the Government out of all monies paid or agreed to be paid by a licensed bookmaker to a backer in consequence of the winning by the backer of a bet made in an enclosure set apart under the provisions of the 6[ * * *] Public Gambling Act, 1867, as amended from time to time, on any race, a tax on backer hereinafter referred to as the betting tax, amounting to twenty per cent. of all such monies.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The betting tax shall be deducted or collected by the licensed bookmaker from such monies at the time when the money is paid to the backer, or in the case of credit bets at such time as may be prescribed, and shall be deemed to have been paid by the backer on account of the tax, and shall be retained by the licensed bookmaker on behalf of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Procedure for making over betting tax to Government</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. All sums retained on account of the betting tax shall be made over by the licensed bookmaker, by whom they have been retained, to the prescribed officer at such times and in such manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Accounts of betting tax</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20.(1) The stewards of a race-meeting shall, at such times and in such manner as may be prescribed, forward to the prescribed officer returns setting out the names of the bookmakers licensed or permitted by them to carry on the business or vocation of a bookmaker at that meeting.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All licensed bookmakers shall keep accounts of all sums paid or agreed to be paid by them to backers in satisfaction of bets, in such manner as may be prescribed, and shall, when required in writing by an officer empowered in this behalf by the Government, permit such officer, or an officer authorized in writing by him in this behalf, to inspect and take copies of such accounts.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Methods of recovery of totalisator tax and betting tax</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">21.(1) The totalisator tax payable under section 15 shall be recoverable as a public demand from the racing club conducting the meeting, and any portion of such tax which is not so recovered shall also be recoverable as a public demand from the stewards of the race-meeting jointly and severally.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All monies which a licensed bookmaker is liable to make over to the prescribed officer under section 19 shall be recoverable from the licensed bookmaker as a public demand.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Rules</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. The Government may make rules for securing the payment of the totalisator tax and the betting tax, the production and inspection of accounts kept under this chapter and generally for carrying into effect the provisions of this Chapter, and for dealing with such matters as are therein directed to be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[Omitted]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23.       [Omitted by 1st Schedule of the East Pakistan Repealing and Amending Ordinance, 1962 (Ordinance No. XIII of 1962).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">---------------------------------------------------------------------</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Throughout this Act, except otherwise provided, the words `Bangladesh`, `Government` and `Taka` were substituted, for the words `East Pakistan`, `Provincial Government` and `rupees` or `Re` or `Rs.` respectively by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The word `Bengal` was omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Clauses (a) and (b) were omitted by the Schedule of the East Pakistan Repealing and Amending Ordinance, 1962 (Ordinance No. XIII of 1962)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The word `Bengal` was omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The word `Bengal` was omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 The word `Bengal` was omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
98	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BOILERS ACT, 1923</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p align="center"><strong>THE BOILERS ACT, 1923</strong></p><p align="center">(ACT NO. V OF 1923)</p><p align="right">[23rd February, 1923]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 An Act to consolidate and amend the law relating to steam-boilers.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to consolidate and amend the law relating to steam-boilers; It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Short title, extent and commencement</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1.(1) This Act may be called the Boilers Act, 1923.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force on such date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Definitions</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context.-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) "accident" means an explosion of a boiler or steam-pipe or any damage to a boiler or steam-pipe which is calculated to weaken the strength thereof so as to render it liable to explode;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ (aa) "Board" means the Boilers Board constituted under section 27A;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) "boiler" means any closed vessel exceeding 3[ 22.76 liters] in capacity which is used expressly or generating steam under pressure and includes any mounting or other fitting attached to such vessel, which is wholly or partly under pressure when steam is shut off;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) "Chief Inspector" and "Inspector" mean, respectively, a person appointed to be a Chief Inspector and an Inspector under this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4[ (cc) "economiser" means any part of feed-pipe that is wholly or partially exposed to the action of flue gases for the purpose of recovery of waste heat;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ccc) "feed-pipe" means any pipe or connected fitting wholly or partly under pressure through which feed water passes directly to a boiler and does not form an integral part thereof;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) "owner" includes any person using a boiler as agent of the owner thereof and any person using a boiler which he has hired or obtained on loan from the owner thereof;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) "prescribed" means prescribed by regulations or rules made this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) "steam-pipe" means any main pipe exceeding 5[ 7.62 cm] in internal diameter through which steam passes directly from a boiler to a prime-mover or other first user, and includes any connected fitting of a steam-pipe; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) "structural alteration, addition or renewal" shall not be deemed to include any renewal or replacement of a petty nature when the part or fitting used for replacement is not inferior in strength, efficiency or otherwise to the replaced part or fitting.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Application of Act to feed-pipes</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6[ 2A. Every reference in this Act except where the word "steam-pipe" is used in clause (f) of section 2, to a steam-pipe or steam-pipes shall be deemed to include also a reference to a feed-pipe or feed-pipes, respectively.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Application of Act to economisers</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7[ 2B. Every reference in this Act to a boiler or boilers [except in clause (ccc) of section 2, clause (e) of section 6, clauses (c) and (d) of section 11, clause (d) of section 29 and section 34] shall be deemed to include also a reference to an economiser or economisers, respectively.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Limitation of application</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3.(1) Nothing in this Act shall apply in the case of any boiler or steam-pipe-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in any steam-ship as define in 8[ section 2 of the Merchant Shipping Act, 1923, or in any Mechanically Propelled Vessel as defined in section 2 of the Inland Mechanically Propelled Vessels Act, 1917]; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) belonging to or under the control of His Majesty's Navy or the Bangladesh Navy; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) appertaining to a sterilizer or disinfector of a type such as is commonly used in hospitals, if the boiler does not exceed twenty gallons in capacity.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, declare that the provisions of this Act shall not apply in the case of boilers or steam-pipes, or of any specified class of boilers or steam-pipes, belonging to or under the control of 9[ the railway].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Power to limit extent</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, exclude any specified area from the operation of all or any specified provisions of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Appointment of Chief Inspector and Inspectors</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5.(1) The Government may appoint such persons as it thinks fit to be Inspectors 10[ * * *] for the purposes of this Act, and may define the local limits within which each Inspector shall exercise the powers and perform the duties conferred and imposed on Inspectors by or under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government shall likewise appoint a person to be Chief Inspector 11[ * * *] who may, in addition to the powers and duties conferred or imposed on the Chief Inspector by or under this Act, exercise any power or perform any duty so conferred or imposed on Inspectors.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) 12[ The] Chief Inspector and every Inspector shall be deemed to be a public servant within the meaning of the 13[ Penal Code].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Prohibition of use of unregistered or uncertificated boiler</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. Save as otherwise expressly provided in this Act, no owner of a boiler shall used the boiler or permit it to be used-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) unless it has been registered in accordance with the provisions of this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) unless a certificate or provisional order authorising the use of the boiler is for the time being in force under this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) at a pressure higher than the maximum pressure recorded in such certificate or provisional order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) where the Government has made rules requiring that boilers shall be in charge of persons holding certificates of competency, unless the boiler is in charge of a person holding the certificate required by such rules:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that any boiler registered, or any boiler certified or licensed, under any Act hereby repealed shall be deemed to have been registered or certified, as the case may be, under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Registration</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7.(1) The owner of any boiler which is not registered under the provisions of this Act may apply to the Inspector to have the boiler registered. Every such application shall be accompanied by the prescribed fee.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) On receipt of an application under sub-section (1), the Inspector shall fix a date, within thirty days or such shorter period as may be prescribed from the date of the receipt, for the examination of the boiler as shall give the owner thereof not less than ten days' notice of the date so fixed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) On the said date the Inspector shall proceed to measure and examine the boiler and to determine in the prescribed manner the maximum pressure, if any, at which such boiler may be used, and shall report the result of the examination to the Chief Inspector in the prescribed form.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Chief Inspector, on receipt of the report, may-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) register the boiler and assign a register number thereto either forthwith or after satisfying himself that any structural alteration, addition or renewal which he may deem necessary has been made in or to the boiler or any steam-pipe attached thereto, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) refuse to register the boiler:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that where the Chief Inspector refuses to resister a boiler, he shall forthwith communicate his refusal to the owner of the boiler together with the reasons therefor.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Chief Inspector shall, on registering the boiler, order the issue to the owner of a certificate in the prescribed form authorising the use of the boiler for a period not exceeding twelve months at a pressure not exceeding such maximum pressure as he thinks fit and as is in accordance with the regulations made under this Act:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a certificate issued under this sub-section in respect of an economiser may authorise its use for a period not exceeding twenty-four months.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) The Inspector shall forthwith convey to the owner of the boiler the orders of the Chief Inspector and shall in accordance therewith issue to the owner any certificate of which the issue has been ordered, and, where the boiler has been registered, the owners shall within the prescribed period cause the register number to be permanently marked thereon in the prescribed manner.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Renewal of certificate</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8.(1) A certificate authorising the use of a boiler shall cease to be in force-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) on the expiry of the period for which it was granted; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) when any accident occurs to the boiler; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) when the bolier is moved, the boiler not being a vertical boiler the heating surface of which is less than 15[ 18.58 square miters], or a portable or vehicular boiler; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) when any structural alteration, addition or renewal is made in or to the boiler; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) if the Chief Inspector in any particular case so directs, when any structural alteration, addition or renewal is made in or to any steam-pipe attached to the boiler;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) on the communication to the owner of the boiler of an order of the Chief Inspector or Inspector prohibiting its use on the ground that it or any steam-pipe attached thereto is in a dangerous condition.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where an order is made under clause (f) of sub-section (1), the grounds on which the order is made shall be communicated to the owner with the order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) When a certificate ceases to be in force, the owner of the boiler may apply may apply to the Inspector a renewal thereof for such period not exceeding twelve months as he may specify in the application:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that where the certificate relates to an economiser, the application for its renewal may be for a period not exceeding twenty-four months.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) An application under sub-section (3) shall be accompanied by the prescribed fee and, on receipt thereof, the Inspector shall fix a date, within thirty days or such shorter period as may be prescribed from the date of the receipt, for the examination of the boiler and shall give the owner thereof not less than ten day's notice of the date so fixed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that, where the certificate has ceased to be in force owing to the making of any structural alteration, addition or renewal to the Chief Inspector may dispense with the payment of any fee.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further in the case of an economiser, the owner shall be given not less than thirty day's notice of the date fixed for its examination.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) On the said date the Inspector shall examine the boiler in the prescribed manner, and if he is satisfied that the boiler and the steam-pipe or steam-pipes attached thereto are in good condition shall issue a renewed certificate authorising the use of the boiler for such period not exceeding twelve months and at a pressure not exceeding such maximum pressure as he thinks fit and as is in accordance with the regulations made under this Act:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a renewed certificate issued under this sub-section in respect of an economiser may authorise its use for a period not exceeding twenty-four months:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that if the Inspector-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) proposes to issue any certificate -</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) having validity for a less period than the period entered in the application, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) increasing or reducing the maximum pressure at which the boiler may be used, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) proposes to order any structural alteration, addition or renewal to be made in or to the boiler or any steam-pipe attached thereto, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) is of opinion that the boiler is not fit for use, the Inspector shall, within forty-eight hours of making the examination, inform the owner of the boiler in writing of his opinion and the reasons therefor, and shall forthwith report the case for orders to the Chief Inspector.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) The Chief Inspector, on receipt of a report under sub-section (5), may, subject to the provisions of this Act and of the regulations made hereunder, order the renewal of the certificate in such terms and on such conditions, if any, as he thinks fit, or may refuse to renew it:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that where the Chief Inspector refuses to renew a certificate, he shall forthwith communicate his refusal to the owner of the boiler, together with the reasons therefor.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) Nothing in this section shall be deemed to prevent an owner of a boiler from applying for a renewed certificate therefor at any time during the currency of a certificate.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Provisional orders</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. Where the Inspector reports the case of any boiler to the Chief Inspector under sub-section (3) of section 7 or sub-section (5) of section 8, he may, if the boiler is not a boiler the use of which has been prohibited under clause (f) of sub-section (1) of section 8, grant to the owner thereof a provisional order in writing permitting the boiler to be used at a pressure not exceeding such maximum pressure as he thinks fit and as is in accordance with the regulations made under this Act pending the receipt of the orders of the Chief Inspector. Such provisional order shall cease to be in force -</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) on the expiry of six months from the date on which it is granted, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) on receipt of the orders of the Chief Inspector, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) in any of the cases referred to in clauses (b), (c), (d), (e) and (f) of sub-section (1) of section 8,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">and on so ceasing to be in force shall be surrendered to the Inspector.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Use of boiler pending grant of certificate</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10.(1) Notwithstanding anything hereinbefore contained, when the period of a certificate relating to a boiler has expired, the owner shall, provided that he has applied before the expiry of the period for a renewal of the certificate, be entitled to use the boiler at the maximum pressure entered in the former certificate pending the issue of orders on the application.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Nothing in sub-section (1) shall be deemed to authorise the use of a boiler in any of the cases referred to in clauses (b), (c), (d), (e) and (f) of sub-section (1) of section 8 occurring after the expiry of the period of the certificate.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Revocation of certificate or provisional order</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. The Chief Inspector may at time withdraw or revoke any certificate or provisional order on the report of an Inspector or otherwise-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) if there is reason to believe that the certificate or provisional order has been fraudulently obtained or has been granted erroneously or without sufficient examination; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) if the boiler in respect of which it has been granted has sustained injury or has ceased to be in good condition; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) where the Government has made rules requiring that boilers shall be in charge of persons holding certificates of competency, if the boiler is in charge of a person not holding the certificate required by such rules; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) where no such rules have been made, if the boiler is in charge of a person who is not, having regard to the condition of the boiler, in the opinion of the Chief Inspector competent to have charge thereof:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that where the Chief Inspector withdraws or revokes a certificate or provisional order on the ground specified in clause (d), he shall communicate to the owner of the boiler his reasons in writing for the withdrawal or revocation, and the order shall not take effect until the expiry of thirty days from the receipt of such communication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Alterations and renewals to boilers</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. No structural alteration, addition or renewal shall be made in or to any boiler registered under this Act unless such alteration, addition or renewal has been sanctioned in writing by the Chief Inspector.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Alterations and renewals to steam-pipes</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. Before the owner of any boiler registered under this Act makes any structural alteration, or renewal in or to any steam-pipe attached to the boiler, he shall transmit to the Chief Inspector a report in writing of his intention, and shall send therewith such particulars of the proposed alteration, addition or renewal as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Duty of owner at examination</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14.(1) On any date fixed under this Act for the examination of a boiler, the owner thereof shall be bound-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to afford to the Inspector all reasonable facilities for the examination and all such information as may reasonably be required of him;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to have the boiler properly prepared and ready for examination in the prescribed manner; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) in the case of an application for the registration of a boiler, to provide such drawings, specifications, certificates and other particulars as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If the owner fails, without reasonable cause, to comply with the provisions of sub-section (1), the Inspector shall refuse to make the examination and shall report the case to the Chief Inspector who shall, unless sufficient cause to the contrary is shown, require the owner to file a fresh application under section 7 or section 8, as the case may be, and may forbid him to use the boiler notwithstanding anything contained in section 10.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Production of certificates, etc</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15.       The owner of any boiler who holds a certificate or provisional order relating thereto shall, at all reasonable times during the period for which the certificate or order is in force, be bound to produce the same when called upon do so by a District Magistrate, or Magistrate of the first class having jurisdiction in the area in which the boiler is for the time being, or by the Chief Inspector or by an Inspector or by any Inspector appointed under the 16[ Factories Act, 1965], or by any person specially authorised in writing by a District Magistrate.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Transfer of certificates, etc</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. If any person becomes the owner of a boiler during the period for which a certificate or provisional order relating thereto is in force, the preceding owner shall be bound to make order to him the certificate or provisional order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Powers of entry</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. An Inspector may, for the purpose of inspecting or examining a boiler or any steam-pipe attached thereto or of seeing that any provision of this Act or of any regulation or rule made hereunder has been or is being observed, at all reasonable times enter any place or building within the limits of the area for which he has been appointed in which he has reason to believe that a boiler is in use.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Report of accidents</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18.(1) If any accident occurs to a boiler or steam-pipe, the owner or person in charge thereof shall, within twenty-four hours of the accident, report the same in writing to the Inspector. Every such report shall contain a true description of the nature of the accident and of the injury, if any, caused thereby to the boiler or to the steam-pipe or to any person, and shall be in sufficient detail to enable the Inspector to judge of the gravity of the accident.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every person shall be bound to answer truly to the best of his knowledge and ability every question put to him in writing by the Inspector as to the cause, nature or extent of the accident.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Appeals to Chief Inspector</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. Any person considering himself aggrieved by-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) an order made or purporting to be made by an Inspector in the exercise of any power conferred by or under this Act, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) a refusal of an Inspector to make any order or to issue any certificate which he is required or enabled by or under this Act to make or issue,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">may, within thirty days from the date on which such order or refusal is communicated him, appeal against the order or refusal to the Chief inspector.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Appeals to appellate authority</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. Any person considering himself aggrieved by an original or appellate order of the Chief Inspector-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) refusing to register a boiler or to grant or renew a certificate in respect of a boiler; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) refusing to grant a certificate having validity for the full period applied for; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) refusing to grant a certificate authorising the use of a boiler at the maximum pressure desired; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) withdrawing or revoking a certificate or provisional order; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) reducing the amount of pressure specified in any certificate or the period for which such certificate has been granted; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) ordering any structural alteration, addition or renewal to be made in or to a boiler or steam-pipe, or refusing sanction to the making of any structural alteration, addition or renewal in or to a boiler,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">may, within thirty days of the communication to him of such order, lodge with the Chief Inspector an appeal to an appellate authority to be constituted by the Government under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Finality of orders</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. An order of an appellate authority under section 20 and, save as otherwise provided in sections 19 and 20, an order of the Chief Inspector or of an Inspector shall be final and shall not be called in question in any Court.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Minor penalties</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. Any owner of a boiler who refuses or without reasonable excuse neglects-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) to surrender a provisional order as required by section 9, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) to produce a certificate or provisional order when duly called upon to do so under 15, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii) to make over to the new owner of a boiler a certificate or provisional order as required by section 16,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall be punishable with fine which may extend to 17[ two thousand taka].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Penalties for illegal use of boiler</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. Any owner of a boiler who, in any case in which a certificate or provisional order is required for the use of the boiler under this Act, uses the boiler either without any such certificate or order being in force or at a higher pressure than that allowed thereby, shall be punishable with fine which may extend to 18[ ten thousand taka], and, in the case of a continuing offence, with an additional fine which may extend to 19[ two thousand taka] for each day after the first day in regard to which he is convicted of having persisted in the offence.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Other penalties</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. Any person who -</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) being the owner of a boiler fails to cause the registered number allotted to the boiler under this Act to be marked on the boiler as required by sub-section (6) of section 7, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) makes any structural alteration, addition or renewal in or to a boiler without first obtaining the sanction of the Chief Inspector when so required by section 12, or to a steam-pipe without first informing the Chief Inspector, when so required by section 13, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) fails to report an accident to a boiler or steam-pipe when so required by section 18, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) tampers with a safety valve of a boiler so as to render it inoperative at the maximum pressure at which the use of the boiler is authorised under this Act,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21[ (f)  generates steam illegally under pressure in any closed vessel exceeding 22.75 liters in capacity,]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall be punishable with fine which may extend to 22[ ten thousand taka].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Penalty for tampering with register mark</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">25.(1) Whoever removes, alters, defaces, renders invisible or otherwise tampers with the register number marked on a boiler in accordance with the provisions of this Act or any Act repealed hereby, shall be punishable with fine which may extend to 23[ ten thousand taka].</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Whoever fraudulently marks upon a boiler a register number which has not been allotted to it under this Act or any Act repealed hereby, shall be punishable with imprisonment which may extend to two years or with fine, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Limitation and previous sanction for prosecutions</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. No prosecution for an offence made punishable by or under this Act shall be instituted except within six months from the date of the commission of the offence, and no such prosecution shall be instituted without the previous sanction of the Chief Inspector.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Trial of offences</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">27. No offence made punishable by or under this Act shall be tried by a Court inferior to that of a Magistrate of the first class.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Boilers Board</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">24[ 27A. (1) A Board to be called the Boilers Board shall be constituted to exercise the powers conferred by section 28.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25[ (2) The Board shall consist of a Chairman and two other members to be appointed by the Government.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3)        [Omitted by section 8 of the Boilers (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. XI of 1990).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4)        The Board shall have full power to regulate by bye-laws or other wise its own procedure and the conduct of all business to be transacted by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The powers of the Board may be exercised notwithstanding any vacancy in the Board.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Power to make regulations</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">28. The Board may, by notification in the official Gazette, make regulations consistent with this Act for all or any of the following purposes, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) for laying down the standard conditions in respect of material design and construction which shall be required for the purpose of enabling the registration and certification of a boiler under this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26[ (aa) for prescribing the circumstances in which, the extent to which, and the conditions subject to which variation from the standard conditions laid down under clause (a) may be permitted;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) for prescribing the method of determining the maximum pressure at which a boiler may be used;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) for regulating the registration of boilers, prescribing the fees payable therefor, the drawing, specifications, certificates and particulars to be produced by the owner, the method of preparing a boiler for examination, the form of the Inspector's report thereon, the method of marking the register number, and the period within which such number is to be marked on the boiler;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) for regulating the inspection and examination of boilers and steam-pipes, and prescribing forms of certificates therefor;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) for ensuring the safety of persons working inside a boiler; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) for providing for any other matter which is not, in the opinion of the Board, a matter of merely local 27[ * * *] importance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Power to make rules</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">29. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules consistent with this Act and the regulations made thereunder for all or any of the following purposes, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) for prescribing the qualifications and duties of the Chief Inspector and of Inspectors, for prescribing or constituting authorities to which they shall respectively be subordinate, and the limits of the administrative control to be exercised by such authorities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) for regulating the transfer of boilers;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) for providing for the registration and certification of boilers in accordance with the regulations made under this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) for requiring boilers to be in charge of persons holding certificates of competency, and for prescribing the conditions on which such certificates may be granted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) for prescribing the times within which Inspectors shall be required to examine boilers under section 7 or section 8;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) for prescribing the fees payable for the issue of renewed certificates and the method of determining the amount of such fees in each case;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) for regulating inquiries into accidents;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) for constituting the appellate authority referred to in section 20, and for determining its powers and procedure;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         for determining the mode of disposal of fees, costs and penalties levied under this Act; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) generally to provide for any matter which is, in the opinion of the Government, a matter of merely local importance 28[ * * *].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Penalty for breach of rules</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">30. Any regulation or rule made under section 28 or section 29 may provide that a contravention thereof shall be punishable with fine which may extend to one hundred taka.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Publication of regulations and rules</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">31.(1) The power to make regulations and rules conferred by sections 28 and 29 shall be subject to the condition of the regulations and rules being made after previous publication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Regulations and rules so made shall be published in the official Gazette and, on such publication, shall have effect as if enacted in this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Recovery of fees, etc</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">32. All fees, costs and penalties levied under this Act shall be recoverable as arrears of land-revenue.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Applicability to the Government</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">33. Save as otherwise expressly provided, this Act shall apply to boilers and steam-pipes belonging to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Exemptions Power to suspend in case of emergency</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">34.(1) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, exempt from the operation of this Act, subject to such conditions and restrictions as it thinks fit, any boilers or classes or types of boilers used exclusively for the heating of buildings or the supply of hot water.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In case of any emergency, the Government may, by general or special order in writing, exempt any boiler or steam-pipe from the operation of all or any of the provisions of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[Repealed]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">35. [Repealed by section 2 and Schedule of the Repealing Act 1927 (Act No. XII of 1927).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">_____________________________________________________</p><p style="text-align: and `Rupees` respectively by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Clause (aa) was inserted 99	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BORSTAL SCHOOLS ACT, 1928 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p align="center"><strong>THE BORSTAL SCHOOLS ACT, 1928</strong></p><p align="center">(ACT NO. I OF 1928)</p><p align="right">[16th February, 1928]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 An Act to make provision for the establishment and regulation of Borstal schools for the detention and training of adolescent offenders.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provision for the establishment and regulation of Borstal schools for the detention and training of adolescent offenders;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ * * *] It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Short title and extent</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the 3[ * * *] Borstal Schools Act, 1928</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Definition</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) "adolescent offender" means any person who has been convicted of any offence punishable with imprisonment or who having been ordered to give security under section 106 or section 118 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898, has failed to do so or who, having been dealt with under the provision of section 562 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">has failed to enter into a bond or find securities or who, when the bond has been cancelled under section 126A of that Code, has failed to give fresh security and who at the time of such conviction or failure to give security</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         in any area where the 4[ * * *] Children Act, 1922, is in force, is not less than sixteen nor more than twenty-one years of age, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) in any other area is not less than fifteen nor more than twenty-one years of age;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) "Borstal school" means a school established by the Government under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) "Inspector-General" means the Inspector-General of Prisons and includes any officer appointed by the Government to perform all or any of the duties imposed, or to exercise all or any of the powers, conferred by this Act, on the Inspector-General; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) "prescribed" means prescribed by rules made under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Establishments of Borstal School</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) The Government may establish Borstal schools at such places as it may think fit wherein adolescent offenders may be detained and given such industrial training and other instruction and be subjected to such disciplinary measures and moral influences as in the opinion of the Government will conduce to their reformation and the prevention of crime.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) For every Borstal school, a Visiting Committee shall be appointed in such manner as may be prescribed and the names of the members of the Visiting Committee or, when a member is appointed ex-officio, the office by virtue of which he has been appointed shall be published in the official Gazette.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Application for the Prisons Act, 1894, and the Prisoners Act, 1900</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. Subject to the provisions of this Act, the provisions of the Prisons Act, 1894, and the Prisoners Act, 1900, shall apply to a Borstal school established under this Act as if it were a prison and an inmate thereof a prisoner.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Power of Court to make order for detention in Borstal schools</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) If it appears to the 5[ High Court Division], a Court of Session or the Court of a District Magistrate, a Sub-divisional Magistrate or any Magistrate of the first class specially empowered by the Government in this behalf in any case that comes before such Court originally, on appeal or in revision that an Adolescent offender convicted by such Court or any Court subordinate to it or failing to obey an order made by such Court or any Court subordinate to it to give security under section 106 or section 118 or to enter into a bond or find security under section 562 or section 126A of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898, should be detained in a Borstal school, the Court may, in lieu of passing a sentence of imprisonment, make an order for the detention of the adolescent offender in a Borstal school for a term which shall not be less than two and shall not exceed three years.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Before making an order under sub-section (1) the Court shall-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) inquire into the age of the offender and, after taking such evidence (if any) as may be deemed necessary, shall record a finding thereon stating his approximate age;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) After considering any report or representation which may be made to it as to the desirability of the detention of the adolescent offender in a Borstal school, satisfy itself that the character, state of health and mental condition of the offender and the other circumstances of the case are such that the offender is likely to profit by such detention.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Procedure where the Court is not empowered to pass an order of detention in a Borstal school</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) If any Court not empowered to pass an order or detention in a Borstal school under sub-section (1) of section 5 is of opinion that an adolescent offender who has been convicted by such Court or having been ordered by such Court to give security has failed to do so is a proper person to be detained in a Borstal school, the Court may, in lieu of passing sentence, record such opinion and submit the record of the case and forward the adolescent offender to or take bail for his appearance before the District Magistrate or Subdivisional Magistrate to whom he is subordinate.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Before forwarding an adolescent offender or taking bail for his appearance in accordance with the provisions of sub-section (1) the Court shall make the inquiry and record the finding prescribed in clause (a) of sub-section (2)of section 5 in respect of adolescent offender.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A District or a Subdivisional Magistrate to whom an adolescent offender is forwarded or before whom an adolescent offender appears in accordance with the provisions of sub-section (1) may make such further inquiry (if any) as he may think fit and may, subject to the conditions contained in clause (b) of sub-section (2) of section 5, make an order for the detention of the adolescent offender in a Borstal school for a term which shall not be less than two and shall not exceed three years, or may return the record of the case to the Court which tried it for passing such sentence as that Court may think fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Appeal</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) Any adolescent offender in respect of whom an</p><p style="text-align: justify;">order of detention in a Borstal school is made under section 5 or section 6 by a Court in any case that comes before it originally may appeal-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) if the order is made by a Court of Session to the 6[ High Court Division];</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) if the order is made by the Court of any magistrate to the Court of Session;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">within two months from the date of such order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The procedure prescribed for appeals in Chapter XXXI of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898, shall apply as far as possible to appeals under this section.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Appellate Court may dismiss the appeal or may?</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) reverse the order make any other order or pas any sentence which might have been lawfully made or passed in respect of the adolescent offender by the Court which passed the order of detention; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) alter the term of detention subject to the limits prescribed in sub-section (1) of sections 5.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Procedure after making order under section 5</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) Every adolescent offender directed by a Court to be sent to a Borstal school shall be forthwith sent to the place of intermediate custody prescribed in this behalf in respect of such Court.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) a copy of the order of the Court directing the adolescent offender to be detained in a Borstal school shall forthwith be sent by the Court to the Inspector-General, who shall take immediate steps for the removal of the adolescent offender from the place of intermediate custody to a Borstal school as soon as may be practicable.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The period during which the adolescent offender is kept in the prescribed place of intermediate custody shall, for the purposes of computing his total period of detention in a Borstal school, be deemed to be part of that detention.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Limitation on powers conferred by section 5</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. Any person detained in a Borstal school for failure to furnish security when ordered to do so under section 106, section 118, section 562, or section 126A of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898, shall be released on furnishing such security or on the passing of an order under section 124 of the code.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Powers of Inspector-General to transfer adolescent prisoners to Borstal school</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. If the Inspector-General is satisfied that any adolescent offender sentenced to undergo imprisonment in a jail or detention in a reformatory school is a proper person to be detained in a Borstal school, he may, subject to the prescribed conditions, direct that the adolescent offender shall be transferred to a Borstal school and there be detained for the whole or any part of the unexpired residue of his sentence. The provisions of this Act shall thereupon apply to such person as if he had been originally sentenced to detention in a Borstal school.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Removal from one school to another</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. The Inspector-General may at any time order an adolescent offender to be removed from one Borstal school to another such school:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the total period for which the adolescent offender was ordered to be detained in a Borstal school shall not be increased by such removal.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Power to release on license</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) Subject to the prescribed conditions, the Inspector-General may, on the recommendation of the Visiting Committee, at any time after the expiration of six month from the commencement of the detention of an adolescent offender in a Borstal school, if he is satisfied that there is a reasonable probability that the adolescent offender will abstain from crime and lead a useful and industrious life, discharge him from the Borstal school and grant him a written license in the prescribed form and on the prescribed conditions permitting him to live under the supervision and authority of such-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) Officer of Government,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) secular institution,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) religious society, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) responsible person,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">as may be approved by the Inspector-General and willing to take charge of the adolescent offender:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if in any case the Inspector-General does not accept the recommendation of the Visiting Committee under this sub-section, he shall report to the Government his reasons for not accepting the recommendation:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided also that no adolescent offender shall be permitted by license to leave under the supervision and authority of a religious society professing a religion other than the religion of the adolescent offender except with his consent or that of his guardian, if any.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A license under this section shall be in force until the expiry of the term for which the adolescent offender was ordered to be detained in a Borstal School, unless sooner revoked or forfeited.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The period during which an adolescent offender is absent from a Borstal school during the continuance of a license granted to him under this section shall, for the purposes of computing his term of detention in such school, be deemed to be part of that detention.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Revocation of license</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) Subject to the prescribed condition, the Inspector-Government may at any time, with the approval of the Government and shall, at the request of the institution, society or person under whose supervision and authority the adolescent offender has by license been permitted to live, revoke a license granted under section 12, and upon such revocation the adolescent offender shall be detained in a Borstal school until the expiry of the term for which he was ordered to be detained in such school.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If an adolescent offender removed himself from the supervision of the institution, society or person under which he was by license permitted to live, his license shall be deemed to have been revoked from the date on which he has so removed himself.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Powers of arrest of police</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. Any police-officer, not below the rank or a Sub-Inspector of Police may, without orders from a Magistrate and without warrant, arrest an adolescent offender who has escaped from a Borstal school or removed himself from the supervision of the institution, society or person under which he was permitted to live by license under section 12, and shall send him, if so arrested, in custody to the Borstal school in which he was last detained.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Transfer of incorrigibles, etc, to prisons</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. Notwithstanding any thing elsewhere contained in this Act, if an adolescent offender detained in a Borstal school-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        is reported to the Government by the Visiting Committee of such school to be incorrigible or to be exercising a bed influence on the other inmates of the school, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        escapes from the Borstal school or removes himself from the supervision of the institution, society or person under which he was permitted to live by license under section 12,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">the Government may, alter the unexpired residue of the term of detention to such term of imprisonment of either description as the Government may determine:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the period of imprisonment shall not exceed-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        such unexpired residue, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the maximum period of imprisonment provided by law for the offence or the failure to give security, as the case may be, in consequence of which the adolescent offender was ordered to be detained in a Borstal school,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">whichever is less:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that no such adolescent offender shall be ordered by the Government to be punished with rigorous imprisonment unless such imprisonment was provided by law for the original offence or the failure to give security, as the case may be, in consequence of which he was ordered to be detained in a Borstal school,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Rules</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) The Government may make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular, and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, the Government may make rules to provide for all or any or the following matters, namely:?</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the control and management of Borstal schools;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the appointment, powers and duties of officials in such schools;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the constitution, powers and duties of Visiting Committees;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the classification, treatment, maintenance, education, industrial training and control of the inmates of Borstal schools;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        the regulation of the powers of the Inspector-General under sections 10, 12 and 13;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         the prescribing of places of intermediate custody in respect of Courts to which such Courts may order adolescent offenders to be sent; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        the form and conditions of licences granted under section 12.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All rules made under this section shall be published in the official Gazette and, on such publication, shall have the same effect as if enacted in this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">___________________________________________________</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Throughout this Act, except otherwise provided, the words `Bangladesh` and `Government` were substituted, for the words `East Pakistan` and `Provincial Government` respectively by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Second paragraph of the preamble was omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The word `Bengal` was omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The word `Bengal` was omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The words `High Court Division` were substituted, for the words `High Court` by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 The words `High Court Division` were substituted, for the words `High Court` by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p>                       </div></div>
100	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE CANTONMENTS ACT, 1924 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p align="center"><b>THE CANTONMENTS ACT, 1924</b></p><p align="center">(ACT NO. II OF 1924),</p><p align="right">[16th February, 1924]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 An Act to consolidate and amend the law relating to the administration of cantonments.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to consolidate and amend the law relating to the administration of cantonments; It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p align="center">CHAPTER I</p><p align="center">PRELIMINARY</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Short title, extent and commencement</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1.(1) This Act may be called the Cantonments Act, 1924.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2)        It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3)        The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, direct that this Act, or any provisions thereof which it may specify, shall come into force on such date as it may appoint in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Definitions</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2.         In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         "Assistant Health Officer" means the medical officer appointed by the Officer Commanding-in-Chief, the Command, to the Assistant Health Officer for a cantonment;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        "Board" means a Cantonment Board constituted under this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       "brigade area" means one of the brigade areas, whether occupied by a brigade or not, into which Bangladesh is for military purposes for the time being divided, and includes for all or any of the purposes of this Act any area which the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, declare to be a brigade area for such purpose or purposes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       "building" means a house, outhouse, stable, latrine, shed, hut or other roofed structure whether of masonry, brick, wood, mud, metal or other material, and any part thereof, and includes a well and a wall (other than a boundary wall not exceeding eight feet in height and not abutting on a street) but does not include a tent or other portable and temporary shelter;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(vii)      "casual vacancy" means a vacancy occurring otherwise than by efflux of time in the office of an elected member of a Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(viii)      "Command" means one of the Commands into which Bangladesh is for military purposes for the time being divided, and includes any area which the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, declare to be a Command for all or any of the purposes of this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(x)        "dairy" includes any farm, cattle-shed, milk-store milk-shop or other place from which milk is supplied or in which milk is kept for purposes of sale or is manufactured for sale into butter, ghee, cheese or curds, and, in relation to a dairyman who does not occupy any premises for the sale of milk, includes any place in which he keeps the vessels used by him for the storage or sale of milk;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xi)       "dairyman" includes the keeper of a cow, baffalo, goat, ass or other animal, the milk of which is offered or is intended to be offered for sale for human consumption, and any purveyor of milk and any occupier of a dairy;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xia)     "elected member" means the Chairman of a Union Committee in a cantonment who has become a member of the Board under Article 12 of the Basic Democracies Order, 1959;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xib)     "entitled consumer" means a person in a cantonment who is paid from the Defence Services Estimates and is authorised by general or special order of the Government to receive a supply of water for domestic purposes from the Military Engineer Services or the Public Works Department on such terms and conditions as may be specified in the order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xii)      "Executive Engineer" means the Public Works Officer of that grade, or the officer of the Military Engineer Services of the corresponding grade, having charge of the military works in a grade, having charge of the military works in a cantonment or where more than one such officer has charge of the military works in a cantonment such one of those officers as the Officer Commanding the Station may designate in this behalf, immediate executive engineering charge of a cantonment;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xiii)      "Executive Officer" means the person appointed under this Act to be the Executive Officer of a cantonment;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xiv)     "Health Officer" means the senior executive medical officer in military employ on duty in a cantonment;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xvi)     "hut" means any building, no material portion of which above the plinth level is constructed of masonry or of squared timber framing or of iron framing;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xvii)     "infectious or contagious disease" means cholera, leprosy, enteric fever, small-fox, tuberculosis, diphtheria, plague, influenza, venereal disease, and any other epidemic, endemic or infectious disease which the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, declare to be an infectious or contagious disease for the purposes of this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xviii) "inhabitant", in relation to a cantonment, or local area, means any person ordinarily residing or carrying on business or owning or occupying immovable property therein, and in case of a dispute means any person declared by the District Magistrate to be an inhabitant;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xx)      "market" includes any place where persons assemble for the purpose of selling meat, fish, fruit, vegetables, live-stock or any other article of food;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8[ (xxa) "Military" Estates Officer" means the officer appointed by the Government to perform the duties of the Military Estates Officer under rules made under clauses (a) and (b) of sub-section (2) of section 280;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxi)     "Military officer" means-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        a person who, being an officer within the meaning of the 9[ Army Act, 1952, or the Air Force Act, 1953], is commissioned and in pay as an officer doing military or air force duty with the military or air forces of Bangladesh, or is an officer doing such duty in any arm, branch or part of those forces; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        a person doing military or air force duty as a warrant officer with either of those forces or with any arm, branch, or part thereof, whether he is or is not an officer within the meaning of the 10[ Army Act, 1952, or the Air Force Act, 1953];</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxii)     "nuisance" includes any act, omission, place or thing which causes or is likely to cause injury, danger, annoyance or offence to the sense of sight, smell or hearing, or which is or may be dangerous to life or injurious to health or property;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxiii)    "occupier" includes an owner in occupation of, or otherwise using this own land or building;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxiv)    "Officer Commanding the District" means the Officer Commanding any one of the districts into which Bangladesh is for military purposes for the time being divided, or any brigade area which does not form part of any such district, or any area which the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, declare to be such a district for all or any of the purposes of this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11[ (xxiva)        "Officer Commanding the station" means the military officer for the time being in command of the forces in a cantonment, or, if that officer is the Officer Commanding the District or Officer Commanding-in-Chief, the Command, the military officer who would be in command of those forces in the absence of the Officer Commanding the District and Officer Commanding-in-Chief, the Command;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxvi) "owner" includes any person who is receiving or is entitled to receive the rent of any building or land whether on his own account or on behalf of himself and others or an agent or trustee, or who would so receive the rent or be entitled to receive it if the building or land where let to a tenant;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxvii) "party wall" means a wall forming part of a building and used or constructed to be used for the support or separation of adjoining buildings belonging to different owners, or constructed or adapted to be occupied by different persons;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxviii) "private market" means a market which is not maintained by a Board and which is licensed by a Board under the provisions of this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxix) "private slaughter-house" means a slaughter-house which is not maintained by a Board and which is licensed by a Board under the provisions of this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxx)    "public market" means a market maintained by a Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxxi) "public place" means any place which is open to the use and enjoyment of the public, whether it is actually used or enjoyed by the public or not;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxxii)   "public slaughter-house" means a slaughter-house maintained by a Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13[ (xxxiia) a person is deemed to reside in a cantonment if he maintains therein a house or a portion of a house which is at all times available for occupation by himself or his family even though he may himself reside elsewhere, provided that he has not abandoned all intention of again occupying such house either by himself or his family;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxxiii) "shed" means a slight or temporary structure for shade or shelter;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxxiv) "slaughter-house" means any place ordinarily used for the slaughter of animals for the purpose of selling the flesh thereof for human consumption;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxxv) "soldier" means a person who is a soldier or airman within the meaning of the 14[ Army Act, 1952,] and who is not a military officer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxxvi) "spirituous liquor" means any fermented liquor, any wine, or any alcoholic liquid obtained by distillation or the sap of any kind of palm tree, and includes any other liquid containing alcohol which the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, declare to be a spirituous liquor for the purposes of this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxxvii) "street" includes any way, road, lane, square, court, alley or passage in a cantonment, whether a thoroughfare or not and whether built upon or not, over which the public have a right-of-way and also the road-way or foot-way over any bridge or causeway;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxxviii) "vehicle" means a wheeled conveyance of any description which is capable of being used on a street, and includes a motor-car, motor lorry, motor omnibus, cart, locomotive, 15[ * * *] hand-cart, truck, motor-cycle, bicycle, tricycle and rickshaw;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxxix) "water-works" includes all lakes, tanks, streams, cisterns, springs, pumps, wells, reservoirs, aqueducts, water-trucks, sluices, mains, pipes, culverts, hydrants, stand-pipes, and conduits, and all machinery, lands, buildings, bridges and things, used for, or intended for the purpose of, supplying water to a cantonment; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xl)       "year" means the year commencing on the first day of July.</p><p align="center">CHAPTER II</p><p align="center">DEFINITION AND DELIMITATION OF CANTONMENTS</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Definition of cantonments</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3.(1) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, declare any place or places in which any part of the regular forces or the regular air force of Bangladesh is quartered or which, being in the vicinity of any such place or places, is or are required for the service of such forces to be a cantonment for the purposes of this Act and of all other enactments for the time being in force, and may, by a like notification, declare that any cantonment shall cease to be a cantonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2)        The Government may, by a like notification, define the limits of any cantonment for the aforesaid purposes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3)        When any place is declared a cantonment for the first time, the Government may, until a Board is constituted in accordance with the provisions of this Act, by order make any provision which appears necessary to it either for the administration of the Cantonment or for the constitution of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4)        The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, direct that in any place declared a cantonment under sub-section (1) the provisions of any enactment relating to local self-government other than this Act shall have effect only to such extent or subject to such modifications, or that any authority constituted under any such enactment shall exercise authority only to such extent, as may be specified in the notification.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Alteration of limit of cantonments</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4.(1) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, declare its intention to include within a cantonment any local area situated in the vicinity thereof or to exclude from a cantonment any local area comprised therein.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2)        Any inhabitant of a cantonment or local area in respect of which a notification has been published under sub-section (1) may, within six weeks from the date of the notification, submit in writing to the Government through the Officer Commanding-in-Chief, the Command, an objection to the notification, and the Government shall take such objection into consideration.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3)        On the expiry of six weeks from the date of the notification, Government may, after considering the objections, if any, which have been submitted under sub-section (2), by notification in the official Gazette, include the local area in respect of which the notification was published under sub-section (1), or any part thereof, in the cantonment or, as
